concise_definition: adv. 自信地, 确信地, 有把握地

definitions.explanation_en: In a manner that shows full trust in one's own abilities, judgment, or the truth of something, often accompanied by calm assurance and lack of doubt.
definitions.explanation_cn: 以充分信任自己能力、判断或某事真实性的态度行事，通常伴随着冷静的自信和毫无疑虑的表现。
definitions.example_en: She spoke confidently during the presentation, even when answering difficult questions.
definitions.example_cn: 她在演讲中自信地发言，即使在回答困难问题时也是如此。

definitions.explanation_en: With a sense of certainty or optimism about an outcome, often influencing others through one's demeanor.
definitions.explanation_cn: 以对结果充满确定性或乐观的态度行事，其举止常能影响他人。
definitions.example_en: He confidently predicted that the team would win the championship.
definitions.example_cn: 他自信地预测球队会赢得冠军。

comparison.analysis: “Surely” (肯定地) 强调对事实或结果的确定性，常用于表达主观信念或推测，但不一定包含个人能力或态度的自信成分。例如：'Surely he'll come late again.' 而 “confidently” 更强调行为者自身的信心和从容表现。
“Boldly” (大胆地) 强调勇气、冒险或挑战常规，可能带有挑衅或鲁莽的意味。例如：'She boldly confronted the CEO.' 而 “confidently” 不一定涉及冒险，只是基于自我信念的镇定表现，更中性、更积极。
“Assuredly” (确信地) 与 “confidently” 意义接近，但更正式、书面化，常用于表达权威性或确定性，较少描述行为者的外在表现。例如：'Assuredly, the results will improve.' 而 “confidently” 更常用于描述具体言行中的态度和风度。
